table_description: DigitalOcean Kubernetes (DOKS) is a managed Kubernetes service that lets you deploy Kubernetes clusters without the complexities of handling the control plane and containerized infrastructure. Clusters are compatible with standard Kubernetes toolchains and integrate natively with DigitalOcean Load Balancers and block storage volumes.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The unique universal identifier of this cluster.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The globally unique human-readable name for the cluster.

columns.name: status
columns.description: A string indicating the current status of the cluster. Potential values include running, provisioning, and errored.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: The date and time when the Kubernetes cluster was created.

columns.name: auto_upgrade
columns.description: A boolean value indicating whether the cluster will be automatically upgraded to new patch releases during its maintenance window.

columns.name: cluster_subnet
columns.description: The range of IP addresses in the overlay network of the Kubernetes cluster.

columns.name: endpoint
columns.description: The base URL of the API server on the Kubernetes master node.

columns.name: ipv4
columns.description: The public IPv4 address of the Kubernetes master node.

columns.name: region_slug
columns.description: The slug identifier for the region where the Kubernetes cluster will be created.

columns.name: registry_enabled
columns.description: A boolean value indicating whether cluster integrated with container registry.

columns.name: service_subnet
columns.description: The range of assignable IP addresses for services running in the Kubernetes cluster.

columns.name: surge_upgrade
columns.description: Enable/disable surge upgrades for a cluster.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: The date and time when the Kubernetes cluster was last updated.

columns.name: urn
columns.description: The uniform resource name (URN) for the cluster.

columns.name: version_slug
columns.description: The slug identifier for the version of Kubernetes used for the cluster.

columns.name: vpc_uuid
columns.description: The ID of the VPC where the Kubernetes cluster will be located.

columns.name: maintenance_policy
columns.description: A block representing the cluster's maintenance window.
